meanings.sent1: The hungry dog chowsed down its dinner in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She always chowsed her favorite snacks during movie nights.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon chowsed on the picnic leftovers, leaving nothing behind.
meanings.sent4: The kids chowsed through the birthday cake like a pack of hungry wolves.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel chowsed on the nuts with such speed, it seemed like a magic trick.

meanings.definition: To consume food eagerly and noisily.
meanings.sent1: The toddler chowsed on the crunchy chips, making a lot of noise.
meanings.sent2: During the feast, everyone chowsed on the delicious dishes with joy.
meanings.sent3: The parrot chowsed on the seeds, chirping happily all the while.
meanings.sent4: The crowd chowsed on the popcorn at the movie theater, creating a symphony of crunching.
meanings.sent5: The family chowsed on the barbecue, their laughter mixing with the sounds of eating.

meanings.definition: To devour food with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The competitive eater chowsed through the hot dogs at an incredible speed.
meanings.sent2: After the hike, they chowsed on the sandwiches like they hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent3: The cat chowsed on the fish, looking like it had won the lottery.
meanings.sent4: The team chowsed on the victory pizza, celebrating their win.
meanings.sent5: The friends chowsed on the buffet, enjoying every bite like it was their last meal.
